New Records: Gibraltar have not scored in their last 13 international matches, with their last goal coming in a 1-0 win over Andorra in November 2022.
Key Match Events: Gibraltar demonstrated resilience by holding Scotland for the first half in their previous friendly, while Wales are looking to rebuild confidence after a penalty shootout loss in the Euro 2024 playoffs.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales are preparing for the UEFA Nations League, with a focus on their friendly against Gibraltar as they look to bounce back from their Euro 2024 heartbreak. Gibraltar, meanwhile, aim to end their 13-match international winless streak.
Post-Match Reflections: A win for Wales would provide a much-needed morale boost ahead of their Nations League campaign, though the match is primarily seen as a preparation exercise.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be played at Estadio Do Algarve in Almancil, with Gibraltar fielding a largely inexperienced squad led by Josh Sheehan.
Others: The article predicts a 0-3 win for Wales, suggesting a comfortable victory for the Dragons.
